Class MicroGames

Object
PluginBase
JavaPlugin
MicroGames
All Implemented Interfaces:
CommandExecutor, TabCompleter, TabExecutor, Plugin
public class MicroGames
extends JavaPlugin

MicroGames

Plugin Note: Microgames is a Spigot plugin for SpigotMC-1.16.5 ({@linkplain https://hub.spigotmc.org/javadocs/bukkit/}) which has little minigames in which people on a server can participate in.

Structure: Each player can join a game which is known as a GameInstance. When a player joins a GameInstance they are transformed into a GamePlayer. GamePlayers are Players but with more attributes to make it easier to handle progressing through minigames. When ever a player wins a game they are awarded score and whichever player gets the set score for that GameInstance wins.

All game instances on the server are tracked with the gameList ArrayList. Retrieve the game list like so... 

 public class SomeClass {
     private final MicroGames plugin;

     public SomeClass(MicroGames plugin) {
         this.plugin = plugin;
     }

     private void someMethod() {
         plugin.getGameInstances().accessMethod();
     }
 }
GameInstance's can be repersented in both Volatile and Non-Volatile states depending on the situation. One example of a Non-Volatile GameInstance is when it is repersented through a Sign. When a game sign is created it is stored as a GameInstance but when the server is reset the onDisable() method stores every game sign in memory inside of the signs.yml configuration file. An example of a Volatile GameInstance is one which is created through the /microgames begin command. This is a temporary GameInstance that players can join through the join command and play normally. However when the server is restarted this Volatile GameInstance is wiped from memory.

All of this code is on my personal GitHub.
Since:
1/19/2021

    • getGameInstances

      public ArrayList<GameInstance> getGameInstances()
      Retrieve the GameInstance's that are currently being held by the plugin.

      What is a GameInstance?

      Game instances are entire games that are being run or can be run that are currently present on the server. Game instances which are saved as signs are saved upon restart and are physically in the game. Game Instances can also be made from commands such as the /microgames begin but these Game Instances are not perminent and are destroyed upon reset.
      Returns:
      List of GameInstance
      See Also:
      GameInstance, GamePlayer

    • getGameInstanceCopy

      public ArrayList<GameInstance> getGameInstanceCopy()
      Returns a deep copy of the gameList. Any modifications to this list will not effect the gameList
      Returns:
      copy of getGameInstances()
